tests.title: TypeScript Basics
tests.description: Test your knowledge of TypeScript fundamentals including types, interfaces, and generics

questions.question: What is the difference between an interface and a type alias in TypeScript?
options: Interfaces can only be used with classes
Type aliases can be extended but interfaces cannot
Interfaces can be merged, type aliases cannot
questions.explanation: A key difference is that interfaces can be merged through declaration merging, while type aliases cannot. This means you can define an interface multiple times and TypeScript will combine them.

questions.question: What does the 'keyof' operator do in TypeScript?
options: Creates a union type of all property names of an object type
Returns all values of an object
questions.explanation: The keyof operator takes an object type and produces a string or numeric literal union of its keys. This is particularly useful when writing generic types.
